definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Tradesmen carried on their business in booths.
sentences.chinese: 商人們搭起棚子開始營業。

sentences.english: Five minutes later Ilyin came splashing through the mud to the shanty.
sentences.chinese: 五分鐘後，伊林在泥濘中啪嗒啪嗒地跑回棚子。

sentences.english: The door of the hut was lashed up with pieces of old ropes.
sentences.chinese: 棚子的門是用幾段舊繩子捆住的。

sentences.english: Paint the shed with weather-resistant paint.
sentences.chinese: 用抗風雨的油漆把棚子漆一漆。

sentences.english: I managed to scrounge the materials to build a shed.
sentences.chinese: 我設法弄來點材料搭個棚子。

sentences.english: They were thoroughly rousted out and their shelters were pulled down.
sentences.chinese: 他們被徹底趕出來，他們的小棚子也被拆掉。

sentences.english: In the shed I saw antlers set out on a stand to air.
sentences.chinese: 在棚子裏我看到一些鹿茸擺在一個架子上晾着。

sentences.english: For shelter, they made a small bamboo hut on the deck.
sentences.chinese: 爲了遮陰避陽，他們在甲板上做了個小型的竹棚子。

sentences.english: While we were there, we went to their hay shed and got a load of hay.
sentences.chinese: 我把這一擔乾草帶回家然後放在花園的棚子裏。

sentences.english: The weight of the snow on the roof caused the shed to collapse.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂上積雪重壓使得棚子坍陷。

definition: to build (esp. with simple materials)/to knock together (a temporary shed)/to rig up
temporary housing built with wooden planks or other makeshift materials
